content: Interesting.  Even the simplest of a directed GA in PHP, dunno what to call it, solves TC9 in under 1100ms w/ <3k guesses.  oops just had one do 3.1k guesses in 2751ms .  even 3k guesses has to do 33k 'fitness' checks.  hmm, thinking a tumbler style would be faster than random_int.

I've just fixed the second constraint:
* There was a typo: [[nLColumns]].
* The upper limit was 7, but in the last three pairs of cases, [[nColumns]] is 8.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The description is clear. @Humanosaure did a great job with the testcases. The contribution is original (as @cedricdd noted: it has enough differences with the bulls and cows one), and the difficulty level is appropriate.

I have an awful solution right now that manages to pass every test but fails validator 7 and 8. I'll send you this abomination by PM. I figured you may want to know that this is possible before I try to optimize it.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The puzzle is easy to understand and the difficulty level is justified by the optimizations required to avoid the timeouts.
The other puzzle based on the same game is only using a fixed size of 4 and can be solved via brute force.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a really nice puzzle. The way I look at the puzzle today is very different than the way I first looked at it. The journey getting from there to here had hurdles and insights I didn't really expect, so enjoy the ride!

Great job Humanosaure! I found the directions easy to follow. The test cases are well done and the recent addition of Test Case 8 and Validator 8 make the puzzle strongly deserving of the hard label, but still doable.

Great puzzle! The only concern I have is with Test 7 vs Validator 7. I struggled a lot more with the validator than I did with the test case, and I was able to create multiple solutions that could pass all test cases, but not Validator 7. I believe this is due to Test 7 having a guess with 3 black clues while the most black clues for any guess is only 2 in Validator 7. Obviously, the black clues are the most valuable information given. I'd like you to consider switching Test 7 with Validator 7.
Hi, maybe I'm missing something obvious but for the example you're giving isn't there 2 possible solutions? If the code was 012 it would give the same results with the guesses that are made.

All sections
* Please format all the variables using [[this_syntax]] instead of {{constant_syntax}}:
   • nColors
   • nColumns
   • nLines
   • colors
   • nBlackClues
   • nWhiteClues
   Please include Goal section when you edit the formatting.

Input section
* Please add line numbers in front of the first three lines and format them in bold, e.g. <<Line 1>>.

* Please change "nLines lines" to "<<Next [[nLines]] lines>>".

* Please add ", separated by a space," after "each containing".

* Suggest to add "representing a guess" after "(from 0 to nColors).

* Suggest to change "riddle lines to solve" to "clues".

* Suggest to change "proposition" to "column" (twice).

Output section
* Suggest to delete "For each riddle,".

Constraints section
* Some cases are inconsistent with the constraint on nLines.

I may have more comments after the above changes are made.

Thanks.

I am still working on the solution. 
If I improve it, I'll write bigger tests.

Well. I improved the solution so that I passed test 6 (10^7 combinations) in less than 400ms. I  therefore add test 7 (10^8 combinaitions) that I pass in roughly 2000ms.

I think that is enough, so I will publish it as it is.

I might still  work on the thumbnail, though, if I find some time to do something cool with Blender (which I might have to do anyway, because I don't fine any nice image online)
Thank you. It is probably much clearer now. Let me know if you have more comments.

Darn, you are right. Back to the drawing board.

I think it was a bug only on the 2 lines ones (they were not even supposed to exist), but I'm going to write a test to check that everywhere.

I move it back to draft in the meantime.

Thank you.

Thank you, Timinator.

That is surprising. I pass Test 7 in 2000ms and Validator 7 in 1500ms. That is why I had chosen that order.

That is maybe because I considere the white clues to be more informative...

Let me sleep on it.

Yeah... That is going to be an issue. I already swapped test and val 7 because Timinator had the opposite problem. I can swap test and val 8 tonight but, to someone else with a different strategy, that might create the problem we want to solve.

I have no idea how you generate your testcases but, if it is not too much work, a better solution would be to add another testpair with the same difficulty level as the last two ones. This only adds coverage and should affect every strategy equally.

That is why I added test 8 :D
And generating the big tests is kind of painful.
But let's see if I can do a couple more...

Yeah I'm sorry, I was fully aware after reading some of the comments down below.

You could also go with the stance that at that point it's the responsibility of the solver. It is a hard puzzle after all, and I knew from the timings that the issue was more likely than not a timeout due to poor optimization.

OK. I added test 9

My times are roughly

Test 7: 1700ms
Val 7: 2300ms
Test 8: 3400ms
Val 8: 2500ms
Test 9: 2200ms
Val 9: 2100ms

(in JS)
The solution I sent you by PM still passes the new test but not the new validator lol. At this point I feel bad, I'll just optimize it and pray nobody comes out with such an approach.

FYI - My final solution solves the validator many times faster than it solves the test case. Because of that, I did struggle a bit with even suggesting switching the two.

I think I need to sleep on it a bit too now that I know you consider the white clues more informative. I'll never use the word "obviously" again. :)

Here are my latest thoughts. You and I have pretty different solutions. I could be wrong, but trying to eliminate all possibility of failing a validator while passing all test cases doesn't feel feasible considering the different ways to approach the puzzle. This is also a hard puzzle so most puzzlers attempting the puzzle will probably have access to the contribution / validators.

That being said, I don't have any other suggested changes. I'll let it sit for a few days more and then approve.

Thank you.

I'm thinking of swaping the test/validator 7 anyway, as you suggested. But I want to add an eighth test to balance it (more white clues in one, more black clues in the other)

I did that. Swapped test/validator 7 and added test 8. The last four tests/validators are of the same size. I tryed to even them out but indeed, hard to predict which would take longer with other algorithms.

My times are roughly :
Test 7: 1500 ms
Validator 7: 2300 ms
Test 8: 3300 ms
Validator 8: 2000 ms

I'd be interested to know if you notice the same proportions with your solution.

It's best that I don't repeat the words that just came out of my mounth. I don't know you and I've never met you, but I uttered some choice words for you just now. I'm at:

Test 7: < 50 ms
Val 7 : 1800ish ms
Test 8 : timeout
Val 8: timeout

Val 5 is about 1100 ms. Everything else is less than 50 ms.

Back to the drawing board tomorrow!

Interesting. I have val5 in about 260 ms.

And thanks for the kind words. I must admit that a reaction of the sort was  among the intended effects.
Come to think of it, I sincerly believe that your solution is much better than mine, but I use a dirty trick to eliminate many options.
I’ll work on it some more this weekend. I’m a bit obsessed with the contest right now. The puzzles I’ve looked at so far are extremely well done IMO.

Test 8 and Validator 8 are great! I really had to look for places to optimize my algorithm and I got pretty lost a few times. In the end, I'm super pleased with the optimizations I added and I think the overall puzzle is very solid now and deserving of the hard label.

I occasionally go over 1000 ms on Validator 8. Test 8 is right about 800 ms. Everything else is very fast.

Unless you have anything more you're working on, I am ready to approve.

Thank you.
It is fine for me. I don't think I will add anything now.
I must have taken a different approach than both of you, for me the slowest one is Validator 5 with ~10ms (in PHP so a slow language), validators 7 & 8 are both below 2ms.

I'm going to have to learn PHP so I can translate my String Balls II solution to PHP and compare apples to apples. You were way faster than me on Killer Sudoku Extreme and since then I've definitely been wondering how PHP and Python truly match up in speed. Either PHP is a decent bit faster than Python or I'm really missing some optimization opportunities!
Well done, cedricdd.

Ok. I ran the test it was the only error.
Honestly, I think it was a copy/paste mistake.
I fixed it.

Thanks again.

Thank you for making the changes! Just a few more comments:

Goal/Input/Output sections
* "(from) 0 and nColors":
  • Please format 0 as a {{constant}}.
  • Please change [[nColors]] to [[nColors]]{{ – 1}}.

Goal section
* Suggest to change "colors proposition" to "a guess on what the color code is".

Thanks again.

Sure. I fixed that.

I also improved the solution and now pass the performance tests in less than 400ms.
I will need harder tests. but the tests generator has become less powerful than the solver :)
That could be an endless race.
And I did.
